text:
Carol Kaelson 
This is not your grandparentsâ€™ Jeopardy . 
On Mondayâ€™s episode of the hit game show, long-time host Alex Trebek busted out rhymes from Drake, Kendrick Lamar, Kanye West, Lil Wayne, and Desiigner. The unexpected mini-performances were the result of a new category called â€œLetâ€™s Rap, Kids!â€ for the showâ€™s College Championship, which continues through Friday. 
â€œThey mad they ainâ€™t famous,â€ rapped Trebek, 76, at one point, delivering lines from Westâ€™s 2016 single â€œFamousâ€ in his signature deep voice. â€œThey mad they still namelessâ€¦But we still hood famous. Yeah, we still hood famous.â€ 
Julia, a contestant who couldnâ€™t help but smile while watching Trebek rap, quickly answered, â€œWho is Kanye West?â€ Trebek replied, â€œYes, and I hope we donâ€™t get an email from him.â€ 
Trebek later revealed his thoughts on his rap skills, telling the audience, â€œI was just getting into this rap thing. Iâ€™m not too good at it, but I was getting into it!â€ How about Alex Trebek rapping on Jeopardy! tonight pic.twitter.com/MNy9CEkf1p
